title: How has recycling culture changed in your country?

korean: 한국의 재활용 문화가 정말 많이 발전했어.
예전엔 그냥 쓰레기를 한데 모아서 버렸는데, 지금은 세분화됐어.
위반하면 과태료도 부과되니까 다들 열심히 해.
요즘은 투명 페트병을 따로 모으기도 해.
정부에서도 환경 보호 캠페인을 많이 하고.
카페에서도 일회용 컵 사용이 많이 줄었어.
대신 다회용 컵을 쓰거나 텀블러 할인을 해줘.
플라스틱 빨대 대신 종이 빨대 쓰는 곳도 많아졌고.
사람들의 인식이 많이 변했다는 게 느껴져.
환경을 생각하는 문화가 점점 자리 잡는 것 같아.
english: Recycling culture in Korea has really developed a lot.
Before, we just collected garbage together and threw it away, but now it's subdivided.
Recycling regulations are also becoming stricter.
If you violate them, fines are imposed, so everyone does it diligently.
Each apartment complex has well-equipped recycling stations.
These days, transparent PET bottles are also collected separately.
The government also runs many environmental protection campaigns.
The use of disposable cups in cafés has also decreased a lot.
Instead, they use reusable cups or give tumbler discounts.
Many places have also started using paper straws instead of plastic ones.
I can feel that people's awareness has changed a lot.
It seems like an environmentally conscious culture is gradually taking root.
